dataset.description: Business related information including development activities, taxes, business list, economic indicators, and government contracting.
dataset.title: Doing Business in Howard County

dataset.description: This is a month-by-month list of all stormwater management inspections performed or overseen by the Stormwater Management Division in the Bureau of Environmental Services. The list includes: Inspection Year and Month, which is the year and month in which inspection field work, additional investigation, and reporting was completed. Inspection Cycle and Sequence Number, which are scheduling and identification codes used by the Stormwater Management Division. Facility Type, which is the design of the facility according to the Maryland Stormwater Design Manual. Facility Location, which is the physical location of the facility.
dataset.title: Stormwater Management Inspections: January 2015 - Present

dataset.description: This report summarizes the various training, technical assistance, and resource offerings by the Office of Children Services.

dataset.description: The National Family Caregiver Support Program is one of the federal Older Americans Act funded initiatives. This report reflects results collected on a quarterly basis and includes key demographics on individuals served with program dollars plus general overall numbers of caregivers served by various methods during the quarter. Methods of service include support groups, telephone, e-mail, education sessions, outreach sessions, newsletters and newspaper.
dataset.title: Office on Aging Caregiver Report

dataset.description: This data set includes the age-adjusted death rates as published by the Vital Statistics Administration, Maryland Department of Health and Mental Hygiene for both Maryland and Howard County.  The rates are adjusted to the 2000 U.S. standard population by the direct method and are calculated per 100,000 population.
dataset.title: Age-Adjusted Death Rates for Leading Causes: 2005 - 2013

dataset.description: Percentage of homes that would save more than $100 annually by upgrading one of the seven components: a high-efficiency water heater, reducing air infiltration by air sealing, increasing insulation, upgrading lights and appliances to more efficient models, replacing windows, upgrading to a high-efficiency cooling unit, and upgrading to a high-efficiency heating unit.
dataset.title: Home Energy Savings by Recommended Home Improvement Components

dataset.description: Calls for Service by computer aided dispatch (CAD) event type, date, time, location, statistical reporting area (SRA), and beat.

dataset.title: Fire & Rescue Personnel Responses: 2012 - 2014

dataset.description: The use of force occurrences by type and year
dataset.title: Howard County Police Department  Use Of Force Statistics: 2010 - 2014

dataset.description:
A listing of all capital projects active in Fiscal Year 2015. This list includes multi-year data and was extracted in March 2015. The fiscal year of each project represents the year it was first funded in the Capital Budget. The financial figures represent all funds spent and encumbered (reserved) and budgeted for each capital project. 

**Note: the budgeted amounts for School Projects differ slightly from those in the Capital Budget, as funding received from the State Aid for Public Schools program and various developer contributions, totaling $185,335,000, is not included.
dataset.title: Capital Project Expenditures and Budgets: FY 2015

dataset.description: To track asset information on County Infrastructure including improvements to bridges, sidewalks, storm drains, traffic signals, etc.

dataset.description: Emergency incidents created by HCPD's 911 Dispatch Center and classified as Fire, Rescue or Emergency Medical Service (EMS) calls. Not all of these incidents are created as cases, and thus not all of these incidents have a matching record in the Howard County Fire & Rescue Incidents table.
dataset.title: Fire Dispatches: 2012 - 2014

dataset.description: The County holds an annual Tax Sale in May or June of each year. Tax lien certificates for properties with delinquent taxes, water and sewer bills or other liens will be auctioned to the highest bidder. On or about March 1, the County will send a delinquent notice to all property owners with delinquent bills and advertise the delinquent properties in the Howard County Times / Columbia Flier for at least four weeks prior to the sale.
dataset.title: Tax Sales: 2010 - 2014

dataset.description: Each Continuim of Care(CoC) is required by (Housing and Urban Development) HUD to conduct a Point-In-Time count of the Sheltered and Unsheltered Homeless population biennially
dataset.title: Point In Time Report

dataset.description: The Coordinated System of Homeless Services (CSHS) is Howard County’s coordinated assessment system to assist homeless individuals and households

dataset.description: This dataset lists various data sources used within the Department of Citizen Services for various internal and external reports.  This dataset allows individuals and organizations to identify the type of data they are looking for and to which geographical level they are trying to get the data for (i.e. National, State, County, etc.). This dataset will be updated every quarter and should be utilized for research purposes
dataset.title: Department of Citizen Services Online Data Sources

dataset.description: This dataset is a conversion of a series of text files used by the regional transportation agency to support a data feed to Google  to support routing functions in Google Maps. For additional information on how to use this data, please go to https://developers.google.com/transit/gtfs/reference
dataset.title: General Transit Feed Specification Data

dataset.description: GIS Files of RTA Routes in Howard County, Prince Georges County and Anne Arundel County
